course_description: The course deals with all problems that arise in cross-border cases (state to state, state-foreign country), such as cross-border contracts, torts, inheritance, family law issues like child custody. The three parts of the course discuss when a court has jurisdiction over out-of-state defendants, what law it applies (its own or another state's), and how out-of-state judgments are enforced. Differences between state and federal court proceedings will be emphasized.
sections: Class Nbr: 1692, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 12:30-2p, Instructor: P. Hay, Status: Open
